{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3602958,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-24T19:59:09.889Z","cooked":"

Here are the slides from the presentation I gave at FIRST Champs. I had a lot of questions about where they’d be posted, so here they are!

Onshape Best Practices for FRC - Championship

The recording will be posted to YouTube and tagged here as well once we’re done editing and cleaning it up.

The slides above are pretty similar to the ones I used at the NE Mentor Conference, so I’m curious if anyone has suggestions - should any topics be detailed further? Are there topics that should be added?

I wasn’t at the presentation so there is a chance this is addressed, but in regards to tube converter lag, I would highly recommend manually patterning tubing. Since the holes themselves is not whats causing lag, more so the way tube converter is making them. If you make a single hole and use a face pattern you can pattern a whole tube for effectively free performance wise. I think our whole 3 stage elevator worth of patterned tube only added up to ~250ms of regen time sketches included.

@Drew_B Thanks for the presentation. I was able to attend this year. As we get ready for our fall trainings, I wanted to see if the video has been made available or if it’s still in process.

Cheers!
